result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Chad Lamson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy Chad Lamson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Timothy Chad Lamson was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with St. Croix County Case #18CM135.
Court dismisses Count 2
Defendant to report to Probation today April 19, 2018 no later than 1:00 pm.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 18CM135

c: Def & Atty. eif

CO: RMW , REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle:  Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Timothy Chad Lamson appeared. Case called at 10:14 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a plea and sentencing hearing. ADA Kelly recites agreement. State is in compliance with Victim Notification. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 Intimidate Victim in 15CM752. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Intimidate Victim in 15CM752. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CM752. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. 20 days to file appeal.

Crt orders:

-   S/W 1 year probation. Run concurrent to St Croix County case 18CM135. DE to report to probation no later than 1:00 p.m. today

-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-    It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Amber R.  

-   Court costs of $243.00. DE to set up a payment plan

-   DNA Sample and Surcharge of $200.00

-  Complete a Domestic Abuse Assessment and follow through with any recommendations

-    Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 19, 2018 at 10:00 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Timothy Chad Lamson appeared. OFF RECORD. Scheduling only. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 19, 2018 at 10:00 am.
filed by ADA Megan Kelly. eif

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Timothy Chad Lamson appeared from jail.  INCLUDES: Plea on 18CM135 and STC on 15CM752.  ADA McKinley states she stiil needs to talk with the victim in 15CM752 before proceeding to sentencing.  Agreement has been reached as to 18CM135.  Atty McKinley recites agreement.  Atty Stormont agrees.  DF is currently on probation in MN.    Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 in 18CM135.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 18CM135. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in  18CM135. Sentencing arguments. Statement by DF.   Bond argument by Atty Stormont as to 15CM752.  Court amends bond to signature bond w/ same conditions.  PTC set on 4/9/15 @ 3:45 for 15CM752. 

Crt orders in 18CM135: 
Sentence W/H
1 Year Probation w/conditions

- Absolute Sobriety
- AODA and any follow through
- Mental Health Assessment and any follow through
- Apology letter to Officer Lau
- Fine - $57
- Court costs - $243
- DNA surcharge - $200
- 60 days to pay

- 12 days credit if revoked

- DF to report to probation by 3:00 today
Status conference on April 9, 2018 at 03:45 pm.

AMENDED:  
I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Day Report Center agreement on today's date. I further understand that I am required to submit to random ALCOHOL testing, at least 2 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in an arrest warrant and/or referral for criminal charges.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing pursuant to the Day Report Center protocols. If UA testing is required, the same shall be viewed in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex. Additional testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Amber R.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
filed by Liesl Nelson appointing Atty Alexander Stormont. eif

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Edward Minser,  DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad,  DF:  Timothy Chad Lamson appeared from jail.  Includes 15CM752 and 18CM135 (BBH). Atty Smestad states Defendant's girlfriend did have the baby this morning and cannot post the $750.00 cash, but his brother could post $150.00. Court did expect a Pretrial Risk Assessment and believes the bail should stand. Bond continues in form and amount. Defendant does qualify for PD. Atty Smestad would like this resolved and would like Discovery as soon as possible. ADA Minser states they will be amending the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 2, 2018 at 10:45 am.
